page.title: 10St. James' Church, Wigan
page.content: Named after James Eckersley, the local mill owner, not St. James, the church has been a landmark on the Poolstock skyline for about 120 years. Its walls are built from local Parbold Stone and are 4 feet thick. A beautiful stone reredos at the front of the church was commissioned by Lady Eckersley when she saw one like it in a French church. It is of the 12 apostles with St. Matthias replacing Judas. The lectern, a large brass eagle, can't be insured as we no longer have the craftsmen to replace it. When the church first opened a peal of 8 bells summoned mill workers to church. Now many houses have been dem- olished and so congregations are smaller. In 1970 nearby St. Thomas' Church was demolished and the two parishes were joined. Our church is now called St. James with St. Thomas. Base 8, St. James' School.
